GGL - Grayscale Graphics Library

1.0

Overview

GGL (the Gray Graphics Library) provides extended functions for 16-color grayscale graphics on the HP49G+ (and possible HP39G+ and HP48gII) calculators. It complements the abilities of HPG by providing faster and more specialized routines for the 16-color grayscale mode. GGL may be used independently of HPG, or seamlessly alongside it.

The main features of the GGL library are:

  • Optimizations for 16-color grayscale drawing
  • Fast bitblt routine
  • Masked sprites
  • Antialiased lines
